title: Boat Loan Calculator — Payment, Taxes, Fees & Amortization

formulas.title: Formula (extracted text)
formulas.raw: Let: P_f = amount financed r = APR per period (APR / periods per year) n = number of periods Payment per period: \( \text{Pay} = \dfrac{P_f \cdot r}{1 - (1 + r)^{-n}} \) Interest each period is computed on the declining balance; schedule rows follow standard amortization where interest = balance × r. Out-the-door price: \( \text{OTD} = (\text{Price} - \text{TradeAdj}) \times (1 + \text{Tax}) + \text{Fees} \) Trade adjustment: \( \text{TradeAdj} = \begin{cases} \text{TradeIn}, & \text{if reduce-tax is enabled} \\ 0, & \text{otherwise} \end{cases} \) Equity applied to reduce financing: \( \text{Equity} = \max(0, \text{TradeIn} - \text{Payoff}) \) Amount financed: \( P_f = \text{OTD} - \text{Down} - \text{Equity} + \mathbb{1}_{\text{financeFees}}\cdot \text{Fees} \)

variables.meaning: periodic interest rate (annual rate ÷ payments per year)
total number of payments (years × payments per year)
property tax (annual or monthly depending on input)
